column1: The coronavirus pandemic has caused disastrous economic impacts. Despite borrowing and spending trillions of federal dollars to provide direct financial assistance to the American people many families still find themselves in precarious financial positions. (5/6)

The U.S. should take a global leadership role in developing AI. Doing so will help put our country on a stronger footing as we recover from the coronavirus pandemic and rebuild towards a better future. That's why I joined @HurdOnTheHill's resolution as an original cosponsor. https://t.co/BYkIYCuWF4

While contact tracing can be an effective method of identifying potential cases of COVID the CDC has not provided substantial parameters for how contract tracers should use smartphone technology with respect to individual privacy.

Many have faced economic and physical hardships as a result of COVID-19. I volunteered with @foodbankofGC to help meet some of those needs. Thanks to the folks at the food bank hundreds of families in the Golden Crescent have been served. https://t.co/aNblfkbkBT

Farmers & ranchers whose operations have been impacted by COVID-19 can apply for direct financial relief through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. More info here: https://t.co/BN3Hj4xw64  I am grateful for their work – especially throughout the pandemic.

Millions in taxpayer dollars sent to the WHO as they've seemingly turned a blind eye to COVID-19 propaganda from the Chinese Community Party and at times parroted the same talking points.  Why should the U.S. fund an entity that does not further the interests of our republic? https://t.co/Kg1cFfw96F

The government of China has taken advantage of the good will the U.S. has shown for years. Now the Chinese Communist Party has manipulated the coronavirus pandemic at every turn — in spite of the heartbreaking human toll.   Discussed the latest with @OANN: https://t.co/fESJzfp05x
Small businesses owners in Texas and across the country: more funding is available to deal with the economic shutdown imposed by coronavirus.  Next up – reopening our economy. https://t.co/NMHeE5dclp

Good news for today ➡️ Cheniere announced it has pledged more than $1 million to organizations that provide essential services to those most in need and at risk during the COVID-19 outbreak.  https://t.co/vnDpTR1x2v

As we work to mitigate COVID-19 we must be careful to ensure our constitutional rights are preserved.  Joined my @freedomcaucus colleagues in signing this letter to @POTUS encouraging individual privacy protections be respected — even by Big Tech — and especially in a crisis. https://t.co/2oWdjlCF6N

This week I've spoken with a number of healthcare providers across south Texas. These folks are daily on the frontlines of the national response to COVID-19. I'm working to ensure their story is being heard.   I signed onto this letter to ensure they get the support they need: https://t.co/0L2yOPGhdO

The American spirit has been evident despite the COVID-19 pandemic as communities all across the country have pulled together to take care of each other.   Here's a good news story from Jackson County: https://t.co/RG33tVVQM3

The government acted to effectively shut down our economy to fight the coronavirus. So it is critically important that we provide this much needed assistance to the American people as quickly as possible to act as a bridge to the other side of this crisis. (2/2)

Small businesses across the nation and at home in Texas are suffering as a result of the coronavirus. I've heard from many local business owners who don't know what the future may hold.  There is more in the works but @SBAgov is offering disaster loans: https://t.co/ODB1LFoCfE

After decades of unethical trade practices and human rights violations the coronavirus crisis should be the final straw against China’s case for global leadership.  Read more in my op-ed:  https://t.co/6HISEInORn

As the federal government continues to mitigate issues arising from the spread of the coronavirus please be aware of this good news:  Tax Day has been changed from April 15 to July 15.   https://t.co/kIr6bHJ9lR
I explained in more detail why I voted no on the Families First Coronavirus Response Act in the @Vicadvocate :  https://t.co/kLhdKRoms5
The U.S. Capitol will be closed to all public tours through March 31 as a precautionary measure against the coronavirus. Please contact my office at (202) 225-7742 if you have any questions.

Last week I voted in favor of $8.3 billion to support the recovery effort surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic and would have liked to have been able to vote yes again but last night’s bill and the process surrounding it represents everything that is broken in Washington. (1/3)

|TX-27: Here's where to get updated information on coronavirus developments and answers to FAQs:  @TexasDSHS || https://t.co/7SRE2xTzJf @CDCgov  || https://t.co/exG6qctUqf https://t.co/qkPDzwmilL  If you need further assistance don't hesitate to contact my office.|
The federal government continues to work with state and local officials to contain the spread and impact of the coronavirus. Here are some things you should know ⬇️ https://t.co/zlGaI08895
